Utterance: <sigh>
Hi! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay. I tried that pros and cons list we talked about, and it helped a bit.
That’s great to hear! What did you discover from the list?
I realized that I have more options than I thought, which was kind of relieving.
That’s a valuable insight. Did anything surprise you about the options you considered?
Yeah, I didn’t think I’d be interested in applying for jobs outside of journalism, but some other fields caught my attention.
That’s interesting! What other fields are you considering?
Well, I thought about public relations and even some marketing roles. They seem like they could use my skills too.
That’s a smart way to broaden your horizons. How do you feel about these new possibilities?
I feel excited but also a bit scared. It’s like stepping into the unknown.
That’s completely normal. Change can be intimidating. How do you usually cope with that fear?
I try to remind myself that it’s okay to be scared. I also talk to friends for support.
That’s a healthy approach. Have you noticed how your friends react when you share these fears?
They’re usually really supportive. They remind me that it’s a part of growing up.
It sounds like you have a good support system. Have you thought about how you can lean on them during this transition?
I think I’ll definitely reach out more. It helps to talk things through.
Communication is key. Speaking of communication, how have things been with your family since our last session?
It’s been a bit better. I tried to be more open about my plans, and my mom seemed to appreciate it.
That’s wonderful progress. How did you approach that conversation?
I just explained my goals and reassured her that I’d keep her in the loop about my decisions.
That sounds effective. How did it feel to express your thoughts more assertively?
It felt good, actually. I think it made her feel more included in my life choices.
That’s a great step towards strengthening your relationship. Are there other areas where you’d like to practice assertiveness?
Yeah, I think I need to work on it with my friends too. Sometimes I hesitate to speak up.
What holds you back from speaking up with your friends?
I guess I worry about hurting their feelings or causing conflict.
That’s a common concern. What if you approached it as sharing your perspective rather than confronting them?
That could work. I can frame it as just sharing how I feel instead of making it a big deal.
Exactly! It’s about expressing yourself honestly while being considerate of their feelings.
I like that approach. I’ll try to keep it in mind next time.
Good! Let’s also explore some coping mechanisms for when you feel overwhelmed in those situations. What do you usually do?
I usually just take a moment to breathe, but I think I can do more.
Breathing exercises are a great start. Have you tried any other techniques, like journaling or mindfulness?
I’ve thought about journaling, but I haven’t really committed to it.
Journaling can be a powerful tool for processing emotions. Would you be open to starting a simple journaling practice?
Yeah, I think I could try that. Just writing down my thoughts and feelings might help.
Absolutely! It doesn’t have to be anything formal; just write what comes to mind.
I’ll give it a shot. I think it could help me clarify my feelings.
Great! I’d love to hear about your experiences with it in our next session.
Sounds good!
Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think we’ve covered a lot. I just want to keep working on being more assertive.
That’s a solid goal. Remember, practice makes perfect. You’re doing really well!
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your encouragement.
You’re welcome! I’m here to support you. See you next week!
